title: Tony Dorsett vs. Barry Sanders: Who is college football's all-time greatest?
text:
USA TODAY

Balloting to determine the greatest college football player of all-time has come down to a head-to-head contest between spectacular running backs Tony Dorsett (Pittsburgh) and Barry Sanders (Oklahoma State).

Voting starts today on Twitter and continues through Sunday at noon ET.

Dorsett (1973-76) rushed for 6,082 yards in 43 non-bowl games and held the NCAA rushing record for 22 years. Counting bowl games, Dorsett rushed for 6,526 yards, including 2,150 in his senior season when he won the Heisman Trophy. His running was the catalyst to Pittsburgh's national title. Dorsett was drafted No. 2 overall by the Dallas Cowboys.

In 1988, Sanders produced one of the most memorable seasons in sports history when he rushed for 2,850 yards and 42 touchdowns in 12 games for Oklahoma State. He never rushed for under 154 yards in any game that season en route to the Heisman. The Detroit Lions drafted him No. 3 overall.

To reach the final of the GOAT contest, No. 1 seed Dorsett defeated Gale Sayers, Tommy Nobis, Lee Roy Jordan, Walter Payton, Earl Campbell and Dick Butkus.

No. 3 Sanders has defeated Mike Singletary, Dave Rimington, Keith Jackson, Bo Jackson, Herschel Walker and Charles Woodson to earn his place in the final.
description: The greatest college football player of all-time has come down to a contest between RBs Tony Dorsett (Pittsburgh) and Barry Sanders (Oklahoma State).
